definition-item.definition-title: MAKING FORGED OR PRESSED METAL PRODUCTS, e.g. HORSE-SHOES, RIVETS, BOLTS OR WHEELS (making particular articles by working sheet metal without essentially removing material B21D; processing wire B21F; making pins, needles or nails B21G; making particular articles by rolling B21H; forging machines, pressing machines, hammering machines, in general B21J; making chains B21L; plating B23K)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Metal forging or pressing methods dedicated to the manufacture of specific products; Devices for handling, heating or cooling, controlling forging hammers or presses.
This subclass subdivides into:
Metal forging or pressing methods dedicated to the manufacture of specific products: B21K1/00-B21K25/005.
Devices for handling, heating or cooling, controlling forging hammers or presses: B21K27/00-B21K31/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making pressed products from metal sheet, without substantially modifying the metal sheet thickness
Making pins, needles or nails by forging
Making particular pressed products by rolling

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: General metal forging or pressing methods not dedicated to the manufacture of a specific product; Metal forging or pressing devices and furnaces
Products per se obtainable by forging, e.g. pistons, rocking arms, etc.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Metal forging or pressing methods dedicated to the manufacture of machine elements.
